str2: Lastly, afterward, later. Neuter of husteros as adverb; more lately, i.e. Eventually.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: To recline, especially at a dinner-table. From ana and keimai; to recline.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To make clear (visible, manifest), make known. From phaneros; to render apparent.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Eleven. From heis and deka; one and ten, i.e. Eleven.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To reproach, revile, upbraid. From oneidos; to defame, i.e. Rail at, chide, taunt.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Unbelief, unfaithfulness, distrust. From apistos; faithlessness, i.e. disbelief, or unfaithfulness.
Feminine of a compound of skleros and kardia; hard-heartedness, i.e., destitution of perception.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to look closely at, i.e. perceive; by extension to visit.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.
